intro: Phyllanthus curranii, commonly known as the African spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial shrub that typically grows to a height of about 1 to 2 meters. The plant features small, green, egg-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stems. Its flowers are pale yellow and are borne in clusters, while the fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds. Phyllanthus curranii is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
